thread.title: GOP's Carson says no to Syrian refugees in US
thread.title_full: GOP's Carson says no to Syrian refugees in US - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: GOP's Carson says no to Syrian refugees in US
text:
By THOMAS BEAUMONT
The Associated Press DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) - Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson says refugees from war-torn Syria ought to be barred from entering the United States.
At a campaign stop in Iowa Friday, Carson says allowing into the U.S. "groups infiltrated with Jihadists makes no sense."
Carson repeatedly warns that the U.S. needs to carefully screen Syrian refugees, but went further, urging the U.S. to settle them in neighboring Middle Eastern countries.
The tough talk comes as Carson and billionaire Donald Trump, the GOP's leaders in national polls, have taken more aggressive stances against Muslims in the U.S.
Trump vowed on Wednesday to deport any Muslim Syrian refugees taken in by the U.S.
Carson launched a petition on Thursday challenging the nation's largest Muslim advocacy group's tax-exempt status, escalating his ongoing rift with the U.S. Muslim community.
